sentences.en: Below the bridge we could just discern a narrow, weedy ditch.
sentences.cn: 我们仅能依稀辨出桥下一条杂草丛生的窄沟。

sentences.en: Give us the power to discern clearly right from wrong.
sentences.cn: 赐给我们力量以清楚地分辨出对和错.

sentences.en: He was just able to discern the road in the dark.
sentences.cn: 黑暗中,他仅能勉强把路辨清.

sentences.en: I began to discern mountains, houses and vegetable plots.
sentences.cn: 哪里是山, 哪里是房屋,哪里是菜园,我终于分辨出来了.

sentences.en: I could but just discern the frowning line of the opposite cliffs.
sentences.cn: 我只能大致辨别出对面起伏不平的峭壁轮廓.

sentences.en: I could discern that he was plotting something.
sentences.cn: 我看得出他在策划某事.

sentences.en: Is it easy to discern between fact and rumor?
sentences.cn: 辨明事实与谣传容易 吗 ?

sentences.en: It is easy to discern a connection between high rents and the lack of housing.
sentences.cn: 显而易见,高房租和住房缺乏是彼此相关的.

sentences.en: It is possible to discern a number of different techniques in her work.
sentences.cn: 从她的作品中可以识别出许多不同的创作手法。

sentences.en: It was hard to discern why this was happening.
sentences.cn: 很难弄清楚这为什么会发生。

sentences.en: No sign of sail or of glinting oars could they discern.
sentences.cn: 他们看不到船帆的影子,也看不到发光的船浆的影子.

sentences.en: She could faintly discern faces, and that was all.
sentences.cn: 她依稀地看出来有许多的人脸而已.

sentences.en: Some people find it difficult to discern blue from green.
sentences.cn: 有些人很难分辨蓝色与绿色.

sentences.en: The man couldn't discern between right and wrong.
We could just discern a town in the distance.
sentences.cn: 我们依稀看到远处有一座城镇。

sentences.en: You need a long series of data to be able to discern such a trend.
sentences.cn: 你需要一长串的数据才能看出这一趋势。

words.tran_cn: 有辨识能力的；眼光敏锐的

trans.tran_en: If you can discern something, you are aware of it and know what it is
to notice or understand something by thinking about it carefully

trans.tran_cn: 看出，察觉出；识别；认识，了解
trans.tran_en: to be able to see something by looking carefully
